wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the creatorsmeet-2 platform. Explain its purpose as an AI-powered matching system connecting innovators with developers based on project requirements and technical skills. Describe the high-level architecture including the Next.js frontend, API routes for backend logic, MongoDB for data persistence, and Hugging Face for AI analysis. Illustrate the core user workflows: project submission, AI-driven technology recommendations, user authentication, team formation, and dashboard interactions. Include diagrams showing system context and major component interactions. Document the value proposition for both innovators and developers, and explain how AI mentor assignment and performance tracking enhance collaboration. Provide real-world usage scenarios and highlight key differentiators from traditional developer matching platforms.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User model in creatorsmeet-2. Detail all fields including authentication (email, password), profile information (name, bio, country, social links), role-based properties (innovator, coder, mentor), and AI mentor assignment. Document the projectRequirements sub-document with fields for description, technologies, complexity, expertise, and preferredStack. Explain the currentProject and performance sub-documents, including task tracking and performance metrics. Include field-level documentation with data types, validation rules, default values, and indexes. Provide sample documents and illustrate the data lifecycle from user creation to profile updates. Address data integrity constraints and performance considerations for common queries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the frontend component structure in creatorsmeet-2. Explain the architectural separation between application-specific components in app/components and reusable UI components in components/. Detail the role of layout.tsx in providing shared UI elements and structural consistency across routes. Describe the composition pattern used in pages, where layout wraps children with global providers and styles. Illustrate with examples such as ProjectIdeaForm.tsx integrating with UI components like TechnologySelector and LanguageSelector. Document the use of Section components (e.g., how-it-works.tsx) for marketing layout and UI components (e.g., header.tsx) for navigation. Include guidance on component reuse, props interface design, and directory organization best practices. Address common issues like style conflicts and hydration errors, and provide optimization tips for bundle size and loading performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Routes Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the API routes in creatorsmeet-2 using Next.js App Router. Explain the file-based routing mechanism under /app/api, detailing how each folder maps to RESTful endpoints. Document the structure of route handlers using Request and Response objects, including middleware integration via middleware.ts. Cover the organization of authentication routes with NextAuth, project analysis via AI, user management, and testing endpoints. Describe request lifecycle, input validation, error handling patterns, and security headers applied across routes. Include examples from /api/project/analyze/route.ts showing AI payload processing and /api/user/me/route.ts for authenticated user retrieval. Provide flow diagrams for API call processing and highlight best practices in server-side logic isolation.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Project Analysis
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI-powered project analysis system. Explain how the /api/project/analyze endpoint uses Hugging Face's zero-shot classification model (facebook/bart-large-mnli) to extract technology requirements from natural language project descriptions. Detail the two-stage classification approach: first identifying high-level tech categories (frontend, backend, database, etc.), then drilling down into specific technologies within the top 3 categories. Document the confidence thresholding (0.1 for primary, 0.05 for fallback) and fallback mechanism when no high-confidence matches are found. Explain the complexity and expertise classification using predefined labels. Include the full request/response schema, error handling strategies, and 8-second timeout implementation for Vercel serverless compatibility. Provide real code examples from the implementation showing how projectIdea input is processed, how techCategories is structured, and how results are stored in the User model. Address integration with the frontend dashboard and signup flow, performance considerations including API latency, and cost implications of Hugging Face token usage. Include troubleshooting tips for common issues like invalid API keys, response format errors, and low-confidence results.

wiki_catalogs.name: OAuth Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the OAuth integration in creatorsmeet-2. Thoroughly explain the implementation of Google OAuth using NextAuth, including configuration of clientId and clientSecret from environment variables. Document the authorization parameters such as prompt=consent and access_type=offline for refresh token support. Explain the signIn callback that creates new users in MongoDB upon first login and logs existing users. Include setup instructions from GOOGLE_OAUTH_SETUP.md for Google Cloud Console configuration, redirect URIs, and generating NEXTAUTH_SECRET using openssl. Provide code examples from app/signin/page.tsx showing the Google sign-in button implementation. Address common issues like redirect mismatches, missing environment variables, and token expiration. Include security best practices for handling OAuth credentials and protecting against CSRF attacks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the authentication system in creatorsmeet-2. Document all endpoints including /api/auth/login (POST) for credential-based login, /api/auth/signup (POST) for user registration, /api/auth/signin for OAuth initiation, and /api/auth/logout for session termination. Detail the NextAuth configuration in [...nextauth]/route.ts including Google OAuth integration, JWT session strategy, and MongoDB adapter setup. Explain the authentication flow from frontend to backend, including cookie-based token storage and middleware.ts route protection. Document request/response schemas, error cases (invalid credentials, email already exists), and security measures like password hashing with bcryptjs. Include examples of API calls with curl and JavaScript fetch, showing proper header configuration and payload structure. Explain how the session callback enriches session data with user roles and profile information from MongoDB. Cover the middleware authentication checks that protect routes and handle redirect logic based on token presence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Interactive Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for interactive UI components in creatorsmeet-2, including buttons, forms, popups, and selectors. For each component, document all props, event handlers (onClick, onChange, onSubmit), and state management patterns. Include usage examples from actual implementation such as the ProjectIdeaForm and TechnologySelector. Explain how animated-button and hover-border-gradient enhance user feedback through visual effects. Detail the implementation of auth-popup and developer-popup for modal interactions. Describe form handling and validation logic in ProjectIdeaForm using React state and callbacks. Cover accessibility features like ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and focus management. Provide guidance on integrating these components with Next.js App Router and handling client-side interactivity. Include performance tips for minimizing re-renders using React.memo and useCallback.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the deployment configuration of creatorsmeet-2. Detail the Vercel deployment settings in vercel.json including version specification, build and dev commands, install command, framework indicator, and region deployment (iad1). Explain the Next.js configuration in next.config.js with focus on reactStrictMode, SWC minification, and unoptimized image handling for deployment performance. Document how these configurations affect build time, runtime behavior, and asset delivery. Include best practices for modifying these files for custom domains, edge functions, and environment-specific optimizations. Provide examples of advanced configurations such as custom headers, rewrites, and redirects for API routing. Address common configuration errors and their troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for authentication troubleshooting in creatorsmeet-2. Explain common issues such as 'Redirect URI Mismatch', 'Configuration Error', and 'Sign in failed'. Document step-by-step resolution procedures using the CHECKLIST.md verification steps. Cover environment variable setup for NEXTAUTH_URL, NEXTAUTH_SECRET, GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET. Explain how to validate Google Cloud Console configurations including Authorized JavaScript Origins and Redirect URIs. Include debugging techniques for OAuth callback failures and session persistence issues. Reference the SessionProviderWrapper.tsx for client-side session management diagnostics. Provide solutions for dependency-related issues like missing @auth/mongodb-adapter. Include logs interpretation from both client and server sides.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Fields
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User model's authentication fields in creatorsmeet-2. Detail the email and password fields including their data types, validation rules (required, unique, lowercase), and security handling (password hashing with bcryptjs). Explain the role field's enumeration values ('innovator', 'coder', 'mentor', 'company') and its role in access control. Document how these fields are populated during signup via both traditional registration and Google OAuth (where password is empty). Include examples from the signup API and authentication flow, and explain how email uniqueness is enforced at the database level with MongoDB indexes. Address security considerations such as password storage, JWT token generation, and protection against enumeration attacks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Metadata
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Project model's metadata fields in creatorsmeet-2. Detail the name, description, status, startDate, endDate, and createdAt/updatedAt fields with their data types, validation rules, default values, and business logic. Explain the status enum values ('planning', 'in-progress', 'completed', 'on-hold') and their workflow implications. Document how project metadata is initialized during creation via the ProjectIdeaForm component and displayed in the dashboard. Include examples of valid and invalid states, and describe the timestamp update mechanism using the pre-save hook. Address performance considerations for queries filtering by status or date ranges.

wiki_catalogs.name: Login Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the /api/auth/login endpoint (POST). Explain its purpose in handling credential-based authentication using email and password. Document the request body schema including email and password fields, and describe the validation logic. Detail the backend flow: user lookup in MongoDB via User model, password verification using bcryptjs, and JWT token generation upon successful authentication. Specify the response format: success returns a JWT token stored in an HTTP-only cookie and user session data, while failure returns appropriate error codes (401 for invalid credentials, 404 for user not found). Include security considerations such as bcrypt hashing rounds, protection against timing attacks, and secure cookie settings. Provide practical examples using curl and JavaScript fetch, demonstrating correct Content-Type headers and payload structure. Explain integration with the frontend signin page and error handling in the UI. Address common issues like incorrect password hashing, token expiration, and CORS configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Profile API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the /api/user/me endpoint. Document the GET method for retrieving authenticated user profile data and the PUT method for updating user profile information. Detail the request authentication using JWT tokens from cookies, response schemas including all user profile fields (_id, name, email, role, bio, skills, country, github, linkedin, profileImage, joinedAt, projectRequirements), and data sanitization practices. Explain the database query using User.findById with password exclusion, default value handling for missing fields, and timestamp generation from ObjectId. Include examples of successful responses and error cases (401 Unauthorized, 404 Not Found, 500 Internal Server Error). Document how frontend components like the dashboard profile page consume this API and integrate with the SessionProviderWrapper for authentication state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the full-stack technology choices in creatorsmeet-2. Detail the use of Next.js 14 with App Router for server-side rendering and API routes, React 18 for component architecture, and TypeScript for type safety. Explain the role of Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling and animation libraries for enhanced UX. Document the backend technologies: MongoDB with Mongoose for data modeling, NextAuth for authentication, and Hugging Face Inference API for AI analysis. Cover supporting tools like JWT for token-based authentication, BcryptJS for password hashing, and Vercel for deployment. Include version compatibility information, setup requirements, and rationale behind each technology choice. Provide configuration examples from actual files and explain how these technologies integrate to form a cohesive full-stack solution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Project model in creatorsmeet-2. Detail all fields including project metadata (name, description, status), team relationships (innovator, developer), timeline tracking (startDate, endDate), budget information with currency support, and technology stack. Document the milestones array with status tracking and date constraints, and the tasks array with assignment to users and status workflows. Explain the progress calculation and its relationship to task completion. Include field-level documentation with data types, validation rules, default values, and indexes. Provide sample documents and illustrate the data lifecycle from project creation to completion. Address data integrity constraints and performance considerations for project tracking queries.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management and Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for state management and data flow in the creatorsmeet-2 frontend. Explain the use of React Client Components and the 'use client' directive in SessionProviderWrapper to enable NextAuth session context across the app. Describe how NextAuth's SessionProvider facilitates global authentication state and protects routes based on user session. Detail the use of custom hooks like use-media-query.ts for responsive behavior. Illustrate data flow from API routes (e.g., /api/project/analyze) to client components using fetch or React Query patterns. Provide concrete examples from ProjectIdeaForm submitting data and dashboard/page.tsx consuming user-specific data. Document state lifting, context usage, and error handling in asynchronous operations. Address common issues such as stale state, hydration mismatches, and unauthorized data access, with solutions. Include performance considerations like memoization, suspense boundaries, and efficient re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the NextAuth-based authentication system in creatorsmeet-2. Explain the implementation of credential-based login, JWT token generation, session management, and Google OAuth integration. Detail the flow from /signin and /signup pages through API routes to database persistence. Document the role-based access control during sign-up with creators vs. developers. Explain the use of NEXTAUTH_SECRET and environment configuration as outlined in GOOGLE_OAUTH_SETUP.md. Cover middleware.ts integration for route protection and session validation. Include examples of token handling in client components via SessionProviderWrapper.tsx. Address common issues like 'NEXTAUTH_SECRET not defined' and provide debugging strategies for OAuth misconfigurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Service Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Hugging Face integration testing endpoint. Document the GET /api/test-huggingface route that validates the Hugging Face API connection and configuration. Explain how it checks for the presence of HUGGINGFACE_API_KEY, makes a direct POST request to the facebook/bart-large-mnli model with test inputs and candidate labels, and validates the response format. Detail the success response structure with testResult containing sequence, labels, and scores, and the detailed error response with error details including name, message, stack, and cause. Include code examples showing how the test masks the API key in logs while verifying its presence, handles different types of API errors (network, authentication, invalid response), and returns appropriate HTTP status codes. Document how this endpoint is used for deployment verification and troubleshooting AI integration issues. Explain the logging strategy and security considerations around API key exposure. Provide guidance on interpreting test results and diagnosing common failure modes such as invalid credentials, rate limiting, or service outages.

wiki_catalogs.name: JWT Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for JWT session management in creatorsmeet-2. Explain the JWT strategy configured in NextAuth with a 30-day maxAge. Document the jwt callback that attaches user.id to the token and the session callback that enriches the session with full user data (role, _id, profileImage) fetched from MongoDB. Describe how the JWT is stored in an httpOnly cookie for security. Explain the middleware.ts implementation that checks for the token cookie and protects routes by redirecting unauthenticated users to /signin and authenticated users away from auth pages. Provide examples of how session data is accessed in protected routes and dashboard pages. Include troubleshooting guidance for token expiration, cookie clearing, and session persistence issues. Cover security considerations like NEXTAUTH_SECRET strength and secure cookie settings in production.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Analysis API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the AI-powered project analysis endpoint at /api/project/analyze. Document the POST request structure that accepts project descriptions and returns AI-generated technology recommendations, complexity assessments, and expertise requirements. Explain the implementation using Hugging Face's zero-shot classification API with the 'facebook/bart-large-mnli' model to categorize project ideas into technology stacks. Detail the request payload format, response schema with confidence scores, and error handling for API rate limits or service outages. Include the preprocessing logic that sanitizes input and post-processing that formats results for frontend consumption. Provide curl examples showing test requests and demonstrate how the frontend's ProjectIdeaForm.tsx component integrates with this API. Document performance considerations including timeout handling and caching strategies. Explain how the analysis results are used for developer matching and mentor assignment in subsequent workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for layout components including sidebar, navbar, mobile menu, header, and navigation. Explain how sidebar and resizable-navbar provide responsive, collapsible navigation with smooth transitions. Document the integration between mobile-menu and responsive breakpoints for mobile UX. Detail how Navigation.tsx and header.tsx coordinate with Next.js App Router for active link highlighting and client-side routing. Describe the layout structure in app/dashboard/layout.tsx and its role in persistent UI across dashboard pages. Include examples of component composition, such as embedding resizable-navbar within header. Cover accessibility considerations like skip links, landmark roles, and responsive touch targets. Provide styling guidance using Tailwind CSS for consistent spacing, alignment, and z-index management across viewports.

wiki_catalogs.name: Build and Deployment Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the build and deployment workflow of creatorsmeet-2. Document the npm scripts in package.json including dev, build, start, and lint commands and their role in the deployment pipeline. Explain the automated PowerShell deployment script (deploy.ps1) that handles git commits with timestamps, pushes to GitHub, and triggers Vercel production deployment using npx vercel deploy --prod. Provide step-by-step breakdown of the script execution flow and its integration with CI/CD systems. Include instructions for adapting the script for Unix-based systems using bash. Cover pre-deployment checks, automated testing integration, and rollback procedures. Address security considerations when using automated deployment scripts and environment variable handling during the build process.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Connectivity Issues
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for diagnosing and resolving database connectivity issues in creatorsmeet-2. Explain how to use the /api/test-db endpoint to verify MongoDB connections and validate schema integrity. Document interpretation of connectionStatus, userCount, and sampleUser response fields. Cover common errors such as failed dbConnect() calls, incorrect MongoDB URI configuration, and network timeouts. Include troubleshooting steps for deployment environments where database access may be restricted. Explain how to verify the User model schema alignment with database records. Address issues related to environment-specific configurations in .env.production and Vercel environment variables. Provide guidance on checking MongoDB Atlas firewall rules and cluster availability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Information
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the User model's profile information fields in creatorsmeet-2. Document the name, bio, country, social links (github, linkedin), and profileImage fields with their data types, default values, and validation rules. Explain how profileImage is populated from Google OAuth or default avatar, and how it's served from the CDN. Include the virtual 'joinedAt' field derived from MongoDB ObjectId timestamp and its implementation using Mongoose virtuals. Describe how these fields are accessed in the dashboard profile page and updated through the UI components. Provide examples of profile data retrieval in the /api/user/me endpoint and demonstrate how the data is structured for frontend consumption. Address privacy considerations and data sanitization for user-generated content.

wiki_catalogs.name: Team Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the team relationship fields in the Project model: innovator, developer, and their relationship to the User model. Document the MongoDB ObjectId references, population strategies, and access control implications. Explain the innovator-developer collaboration workflow, including how the innovator initiates the project and how developers are assigned. Include code examples showing how these relationships are queried and updated in API routes. Describe the business rules around role permissions and data visibility between innovators and developers. Address common issues like orphaned references and provide solutions for maintaining referential integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Signup Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the /api/auth/signup endpoint (POST) responsible for user registration. Detail the request payload structure containing name, email, password, and role. Explain the implementation flow: database connection via dbConnect, checking for existing users by email, password hashing with bcryptjs, and creating a new User document in MongoDB with default values for profile and preferences. Document success response (201 Created with user ID) and error cases (409 Conflict for duplicate email, 400 Bad Request for validation errors). Highlight the role assignment logic during signup and its impact on user permissions and dashboard access. Include code examples for client-side integration, showing form validation and submission handling. Discuss security practices including password strength requirements, secure hashing, and prevention of enumeration attacks. Reference the signup form components and their state management. Address potential issues like database insertion failures, unhandled promise rejections, and email verification considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Requirements API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the /api/user/update-requirements POST endpoint. Explain how this API updates a user's project requirements including description, technologies, complexity, expertise, and preferredStack. Document the JWT-based authentication flow, request validation for required fields, and MongoDB update operation using User.findByIdAndUpdate with retry logic for database resilience. Detail the request body schema, response format, and error handling for validation failures (400 Bad Request) and user not found scenarios (404 Not Found). Explain the integration with the User model's projectRequirements schema and how the frontend ProjectIdeaForm component submits data to this endpoint after AI analysis. Include performance considerations around the retry mechanism and database connection management via dbConnect.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the project's file organization. Break down each top-level directory: app/ for pages and API routes, components/ for reusable UI elements, lib/ for utilities and database connection, models/ for MongoDB schemas, and hooks/ for custom React hooks. Explain the significance of configuration files like next.config.js, tailwind.config.js, and vercel.json. Detail the App Router structure within app/ including page.tsx, layout.tsx, and route.ts files. Describe how the component hierarchy separates marketing UI (components/sections) from application UI (components/ui). Include file path conventions, naming patterns, and guidance on where to place new features. Provide visual mapping of the directory tree and explain the rationale behind the current organization for optimal developer experience.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing and Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for routing and navigation in the creatorsmeet-2 application using Next.js App Router. Explain the file-based routing mechanism where directories like dashboard/ map to /dashboard routes and page.tsx serves as the route handler. Describe the role of layout.tsx in maintaining persistent UI elements (e.g., navigation bars) across nested routes without re-rendering. Detail the implementation of Navigation.tsx and sidebar.tsx for in-app navigation with client-side routing via Next.js Link or router.push. Illustrate route organization for authentication flows (signin, signup) and protected dashboard routes. Include examples of dynamic routing if applicable and middleware integration for authentication checks. Address common navigation issues such as route loading states, 404 handling, and scroll restoration. Provide best practices for route grouping, code splitting, and prefetching to enhance UX and performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Analysis Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AI-powered project analysis pipeline. Detail how user-submitted project ideas are processed through Hugging Face's zero-shot classification API to extract technology stack recommendations, complexity assessment, and expertise requirements. Explain the implementation in /api/project/analyze/route.ts, including prompt engineering, candidate labels, and confidence thresholding. Document the integration with frontend components like ProjectIdeaForm.tsx and error handling for API rate limits or failures. Cover the test endpoint /api/test-huggingface for service validation. Include performance considerations such as caching strategies, request batching, and fallback mechanisms. Provide sample payloads and responses to illustrate the AI inference workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Utility Functions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the utility functions used in the AI integration system. While cn() from lib/utils.ts is primarily a UI utility for className merging, explain its indirect role in rendering AI analysis results in the frontend components. Detail the function's implementation using clsx and tailwind-merge, and provide examples of how it ensures proper Tailwind CSS class concatenation when displaying technology tags, complexity badges, or expertise indicators from AI analysis results. Although not directly involved in AI processing, document how consistent styling through this utility enhances the presentation of AI-generated recommendations. Include usage examples from potential components that display analysis results, showing how dynamic classes for confidence levels or technology categories are properly merged. Note that no additional AI-specific utility functions currently exist in this file, but the pattern supports future extension.

wiki_catalogs.name: Role-Based Access Control
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for role-based access control in creatorsmeet-2. Explain the two primary roles: 'innovator' and 'coder', with default assignment during Google OAuth sign-in. Document how the role is stored in the User model and attached to the session via the session callback. Describe the role selection interface in app/signup/page.tsx where users can choose their role during registration. Explain how role influences UI rendering and feature access in the dashboard (e.g., project submission vs. developer matching). Provide examples of role-based logic in API routes and components. Include guidance on extending roles in the future and securing role updates to prevent privilege escalation. Address data privacy implications based on user roles and how role data is used for AI mentor assignment.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the user management API endpoints in creatorsmeet-2. Cover /api/user/me for retrieving authenticated user data, /api/user/update-requirements for modifying project requirements, /api/user/assign-mentor for AI mentor assignment, /api/user/performance for tracking user metrics, /api/user/team for team membership management, and /api/user/profile-image for updating profile pictures. For each endpoint, document HTTP methods, request/response schemas, authentication requirements, and integration with the User model in MongoDB. Explain how the endpoints validate user permissions and handle data updates with proper error responses. Include examples showing how frontend dashboard components consume these APIs. Detail the data flow from API request to database update and response serialization. Document any middleware or authorization checks applied to these routes and explain how user data is protected and sanitized before storage.

wiki_catalogs.name: Marketing Sections
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for marketing-oriented UI sections including how-it-works, developers, and contact. Explain how these components are used on the landing page to communicate value propositions and drive user conversion. Document the use of 3d-card and grid-background to create visually engaging layouts with depth and motion. Detail the implementation of how-it-works with step-by-step illustrations and animations. Describe the developers section's role in showcasing developer profiles and skills. Cover the contact form integration and submission handling. Include guidance on responsive design for these sections across desktop and mobile. Explain animation strategies using CSS transforms and Tailwind classes for smooth entry effects. Provide customization options for colors, content, and layout via props and CSS variables.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment and Database Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for managing environment variables and database connections during deployment. Explain the use of .env.production for storing production secrets such as MongoDB connection strings, Hugging Face API keys, and authentication credentials. Document the database connection logic in lib/db.ts including connection pooling, error handling, and global state management. Detail how Vercel's environment variable system integrates with the application through vercel.json. Provide guidelines for configuring MongoDB Atlas versus self-hosted instances, including connection string formats, SSL settings, and network access controls. Include best practices for environment segregation (local, preview, production), secret rotation, and security hardening. Address common deployment issues related to environment variables and database connectivity with troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI API Errors
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for troubleshooting Hugging Face AI API integration issues in creatorsmeet-2. Explain how to use the /api/test-huggingface endpoint to validate API key configuration and network connectivity. Document interpretation of success, error, and details response fields. Cover common issues such as missing HUGGINGFACE_API_KEY, invalid authorization headers, and rate limiting. Include debugging strategies using the test API interface (app/test-api/page.tsx) to simulate project analysis requests. Explain how to interpret zero-shot classification response formats and handle unexpected payloads. Address timeout issues during model inference and provide retry logic recommendations. Include steps to verify the facebook/bart-large-mnli model availability and fallback mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Requirements
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the projectRequirements sub-document in the User model. Detail each field: description (project idea text), technologies (array of tech stack recommendations), complexity (project difficulty level), expertise (required developer skill level), preferredStack (user's technology preference), and lastAnalyzed (timestamp of AI analysis). Explain how this sub-document is populated through the AI analysis pipeline using Hugging Face's zero-shot classification in the /api/project/analyze endpoint. Document the data flow from ProjectIdeaForm submission to AI processing and storage. Include examples of how innovators update requirements and how coders are matched based on technology alignment. Address data integrity, indexing strategies for query performance, and the relationship between project requirements and developer matching algorithms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Budget Information
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the budget sub-document in the Project model, including min, max, and currency fields. Detail the data types, validation constraints, and default currency (USD). Explain how budget information is used in the matching algorithm to connect innovators with suitable developers. Document the schema design decision to embed budget within the project rather than separate collection. Provide examples of budget range queries and discuss performance implications of indexing strategies. Include guidance on how to extend the budget schema for additional features like payment milestones or expense tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: OAuth Sign-In Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create in-depth documentation for the OAuth sign-in flow initiated via /api/auth/signin. Explain how this endpoint integrates with NextAuth and Google OAuth provider as configured in [...nextauth]/route.ts. Detail the OAuth2 authorization code flow: client initiation, Google consent screen, token exchange, and callback handling. Document the GoogleProvider configuration including clientId, clientSecret, and authorization parameters (prompt=consent, access_type=offline). Explain the signIn callback logic that creates new users in MongoDB upon first login and logs existing users. Describe the session callback that enriches the session with user role, ID, and profile image from the database. Cover the JWT callback that attaches user ID to the token. Include environment variable requirements (GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, NEXTAUTH_SECRET) and setup instructions from GOOGLE_OAUTH_SETUP.md. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like 'NEXTAUTH_SECRET is not defined', misconfigured redirect URIs, and offline access token failures. Show example implementations in the frontend signin page and error handling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Mentor Assignment API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the /api/user/assign-mentor API endpoints. Cover both the POST method for assigning an AI mentor based on user role and project requirements, and the GET method for retrieving the current AI mentor with automatic assignment if none exists. Document the AI_MENTORS configuration array, the findBestMentorMatch algorithm that differentiates between 'innovator' and 'coder' roles, and the user.aiMentor schema update process. Explain the authentication flow using JWT tokens, error handling, and response formats. Detail how the frontend dashboard uses this API to display mentor guidance and how the mentor assignment enhances the user experience by providing role-specific expertise. Include examples of mentor objects returned by the API and their integration with the User model.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend component system in creatorsmeet-2. Describe the React component tree structure using Next.js App Router, highlighting the role of layout.tsx for shared UI and page.tsx for route-specific content. Explain the component categorization between app/components (application-specific) and components/ (reusable UI). Detail the state management approach using React hooks and client-side data fetching. Document the UI component library in components/ui including 3D cards, animated buttons, and responsive navigation. Illustrate data flow from API routes to frontend components, focusing on the project idea submission and dashboard display. Include examples of component composition, props drilling patterns, and context usage through SessionProviderWrapper. Address responsive design implementation and accessibility considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the UI component library in creatorsmeet-2. Describe each component's visual design, interaction behavior, and intended use cases. For 3d-card.tsx, explain the CSS 3D transforms and hover effects for depth perception. For animated-button.tsx, document the animation triggers, transition curves, and accessibility considerations (e.g., focus states). Detail hover-border-gradient.tsx's animated border implementation using CSS keyframes and pseudo-elements. Explain resizable-navbar.tsx and mobile-menu.tsx for responsive navigation across devices. Include usage examples with props (e.g., colors, sizes, labels), event callbacks, and integration with parent components. Provide guidelines for theming using Tailwind CSS and dark mode support. Address cross-browser compatibility, touch device responsiveness, and performance impact of animations. Include troubleshooting tips for rendering glitches and layout shifts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Connection Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for MongoDB connection management using Mongoose in creatorsmeet-2. Explain the global caching pattern implemented in lib/db.ts to prevent multiple connections in serverless environments. Document the connection lifecycle, including initialization, error handling, disconnection events, and readyState monitoring via getConnectionStatus(). Detail the configuration options like maxPoolSize, socketTimeoutMS, and bufferCommands. Explain how models (User and Project) are registered after connection establishment. Include best practices for handling connection loss and scaling considerations for Vercel deployments. Provide debugging guidance for common issues like 'MongoDB disconnected' warnings and connection timeouts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing APIs
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create documentation for the testing and health check APIs in creatorsmeet-2. Document /api/test-db which verifies MongoDB connection health by performing a simple query, and /api/test-huggingface which validates the Hugging Face Inference API integration by making a test classification request. For each endpoint, explain the implementation details, expected success responses, and failure conditions with appropriate HTTP status codes. Document how these endpoints are used in deployment pipelines and production monitoring to ensure service availability. Include curl command examples for manual testing and explain how these endpoints can be integrated with uptime monitoring services. Describe the security considerations for these testing endpoints, including whether they are accessible in production and any authentication requirements. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues detected through these health checks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Problems
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for resolving deployment issues in creatorsmeet-2. Cover common problems encountered during Vercel deployment including environment variable misconfiguration, build failures, and post-deployment functionality validation. Explain how to use the CHECKLIST.md to verify production setup completeness. Document the role of vercel.json in routing and edge function configuration. Address issues related to NEXTAUTH_URL mismatches between development and production environments. Include troubleshooting steps for static asset loading, API route 404s, and client-server communication failures after deployment. Provide guidance on interpreting Vercel build logs and using deploy.ps1 for local deployment simulation. Cover cache invalidation and DNS propagation delays affecting deployment visibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Metrics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the performance sub-document in the User model. Detail the communicationScore, collaborationScore, deliverySpeed, and codeQuality fields including their data types, default values (0), and constraints (0-100 range). Explain the lastUpdated timestamp and how performance data is aggregated from project activities and peer reviews. Document how this data is retrieved via the /api/user/performance endpoint and displayed in the performance dashboard. Include examples of performance score updates based on task completion and milestone achievements. Address the use of MongoDB indexes for performance queries and the integration with the project management system. Provide guidance on how mentors and team leads can view and interpret these metrics for developer evaluation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the technologies array in the Project model. Explain how this field is populated through AI analysis using Hugging Face's zero-shot classification, starting from the project idea input in ProjectIdeaForm. Document the workflow from user input  /api/project/analyze  technology recommendations  storage in Project model. Include the confidence threshold filtering (0.1) and fallback mechanisms when no high-confidence matches are found. Describe how the technologies array is used in developer matching based on their skill stack. Provide examples of technology recommendation results and discuss accuracy improvement strategies. Address data consistency between the analyzed technologies and user-edited values.

wiki_catalogs.name: Logout Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the /api/auth/logout endpoint (POST) responsible for session termination. Explain its function in clearing the authentication token from cookies and invalidating the session. Detail the implementation: removing the JWT token cookie with proper path and secure flags, and any server-side session cleanup if implemented. Describe the expected request format (empty body) and response (200 OK with success message). Explain integration with the frontend navigation component and user experience considerations like redirect after logout. Discuss security aspects such as ensuring the cookie is properly cleared across domains, preventing logout CSRF, and handling concurrent sessions. Provide usage examples with fetch API showing proper credentials inclusion. Address edge cases like logging out when no session exists and browser back-button behavior after logout. Reference the middleware.ts authentication checks that redirect unauthenticated users back to signin.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Tracking API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the /api/user/performance GET endpoint that provides user performance analytics. Document how the API retrieves the user's active project and performance metrics, calculates project progress based on task completion, and formats milestone data for display. Explain the response structure including projectProgress, tasksCompleted, totalTasks, milestones array, and teamMetrics (communicationScore, collaborationScore, deliverySpeed, codeQuality). Detail the authentication process, database population of activeProject data, and error handling for missing users or active projects. Describe how the dashboard performance page consumes this API to visualize user progress and team effectiveness, and how the data supports the platform's mentorship and collaboration features.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend services in creatorsmeet-2. Describe the API route structure using Next.js App Router conventions, with endpoints organized under /api for authentication, project analysis, user management, and testing. Explain the server-side logic flow from API routes to database operations via Mongoose models. Detail the authentication system built with NextAuth, including JWT token handling and session management. Document the AI analysis pipeline that processes project ideas through Hugging Face's zero-shot classification. Cover the database connection management in lib/db.ts with global state pattern. Include error handling strategies, input validation, and security measures implemented across API routes. Provide sequence diagrams for critical operations like user login and project analysis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Requirements API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the project requirements management endpoint at /api/project-requirements/update. Document the POST request structure that allows users to update their project technology stack, complexity preferences, and expertise requirements. Explain the validation logic that ensures data integrity and the integration with the User model in MongoDB. Detail the request payload format, response schema, and error handling for invalid inputs or unauthorized access. Include examples showing how the frontend components interact with this API to save user preferences. Explain how these requirements are used in the AI mentor assignment and developer matching algorithms. Document any data transformation or normalization applied to the requirements before storage and how they influence project analysis results.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Mentor Assignment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the aiMentor sub-document in the User model. Document the name, expertise (array of technical domains), avatar, description, and assignedAt fields with their data types and constraints. Explain how AI mentors are assigned based on project requirements and user role, including the logic in the /api/user/assign-mentor endpoint. Describe how mentor data is displayed in the team dashboard and used to provide guidance to innovators and developers. Include examples of mentor assignment workflows and how users interact with their AI mentors through the platform. Address the extensibility of the mentor system for future AI capabilities and the data structure's support for multiple mentor types. Document the MongoDB schema design decisions and indexing strategy for mentor-based queries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Milestones
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the milestones array in the Project model. Detail the milestone schema including name, description, status ('completed', 'in-progress', 'upcoming'), date, and associated tasks. Explain the lifecycle of milestones from planning to completion and how they relate to overall project progress calculation. Document the data validation rules, particularly the required date field and status transitions. Include examples of milestone management workflows and discuss query patterns for filtering milestones by date or status. Address performance considerations for milestone-heavy projects and potential indexing strategies on the date field.

wiki_catalogs.name: NextAuth Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the NextAuth configuration in [...nextauth]/route.ts. Explain the authOptions object structure including adapter (MongoDBAdapter), providers (Google), callbacks (signIn, session, jwt), pages, session strategy (JWT), and secret management. Detail the MongoDB adapter setup using clientPromise and its role in persisting user sessions and accounts. Explain the session callback's critical function in attaching user role, ID, and profile data from MongoDB to the session object consumed by the frontend. Describe the JWT callback's purpose in token serialization. Document the pages configuration that customizes signIn, error, and newUser redirects. Cover session settings including 30-day maxAge and JWT strategy benefits. Explain the middleware.ts integration that protects routes by checking for authentication tokens and enforcing redirect rules based on pathname. Include security best practices for NEXTAUTH_SECRET generation using openssl rand -base64 32. Provide debugging tips using the debug flag in development. Address common deployment issues related to environment variables and adapter connectivity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Team Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the /api/user/team GET endpoint that manages team collaboration features. Explain how the API authenticates the user via JWT token, retrieves the current user's data, and populates the matchedWith field to find their team member. Document the response format containing the team member's profile information (excluding password) and error cases when no team member is found. Detail the integration with the User model's matchedWith reference field and how the frontend team dashboard uses this API to display collaborator information, enable communication, and support project coordination. Include information about the data flow from API request to database query and the security considerations around data exposure.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the MongoDB schemas in creatorsmeet-2. Detail the User model including fields for authentication (email, password), profile information (name, role, profileImage), project tracking (currentProject, projectHistory), and AI mentor assignment. Document the Project model with tasks, milestones, team members, budget, and progress tracking. Explain the relationship between users and projects, including role-based access control. Include field-level documentation with data types, validation rules, default values, and indexes. Provide sample documents for both models and illustrate the data lifecycle from creation to archival. Address data integrity constraints, referential integrity patterns, and performance considerations for queries. Document the connection pooling and caching strategy in lib/db.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tasks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the tasks array in the Project model. Document the task schema with title, description, status ('todo', 'in-progress', 'completed'), assignedTo (User reference), and timestamps. Explain how tasks are assigned to developers and tracked in the performance dashboard. Describe the relationship between tasks and milestones, including how milestone completion depends on associated tasks. Include examples of task assignment workflows and status update mechanisms. Discuss the pre-save hook behavior for updatedAt timestamps and its impact on task tracking. Address data integrity concerns around task deletion and orphaned references in milestones.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Image API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the /api/user/profile-image POST endpoint that handles user profile image uploads. Document the multipart form data request format, file validation, and server-side file storage in the public/images/profiles directory using Node.js fs module. Explain the authentication flow with JWT tokens, unique filename generation using userId and timestamp, and database update to store the image path in user.profileImage. Detail the response format with success messages and imageUrl, as well as error handling for missing images or upload failures. Discuss the current file system storage approach and recommendations for production deployment using cloud storage services like AWS S3. Explain how the frontend profile page integrates this API for image uploads and displays the updated profile picture.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public endpoints in creatorsmeet-2. For each API group, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Start with authentication endpoints (/api/auth/login, /api/auth/signup) detailing JWT token issuance and session management. Document the project analysis endpoint (/api/project/analyze) including the zero-shot classification implementation with Hugging Face. Cover user management APIs for profile updates, team assignment, and performance tracking. Include testing endpoints (/api/test-db, /api/test-huggingface) for service health checks. For each endpoint, provide curl examples, sample requests/responses, error codes, and rate limiting policies. Document the API security model using middleware.ts and JWT validation. Include client implementation guidelines for frontend integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Progress Calculation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the progress field in the Project model. Explain how the progress percentage (0-100) is calculated based on task completion rates and potentially milestone achievement. Document the default value (0) and update mechanisms - whether it's updated automatically via server logic or manually through API calls. Describe how progress is displayed in the dashboard and performance tracking views. Include the algorithm for progress calculation, edge cases (e.g., no tasks), and performance implications of real-time progress updates. Provide examples of progress calculation scenarios and discuss potential enhancements like weighted task scoring.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the AI-powered project analysis system. Explain how the /api/project/analyze endpoint uses Hugging Face's zero-shot classification to extract technology requirements from natural language project descriptions. Detail the prompt engineering approach, candidate labels (technologies), and confidence thresholding. Document the preprocessing and post-processing steps in the analysis pipeline. Explain how AI recommendations are stored and used for developer matching. Cover the testing interface at /api/test-huggingface for validating AI responses. Include performance metrics, latency considerations, and fallback strategies for API failures. Provide examples of effective vs. ineffective project descriptions and optimization tips for better AI results. Address cost implications and rate limiting with Hugging Face API.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the authentication system in creatorsmeet-2. Detail the implementation of NextAuth with Google OAuth integration, including callback handling and JWT token generation. Explain the multi-step authentication flow from sign-in/signup pages to session creation. Document the role-based access control with different user types (innovator, developer). Cover password management, session persistence, and secure cookie handling. Explain the middleware.ts implementation for route protection. Include setup instructions from GOOGLE_OAUTH_SETUP.md for configuring Google Cloud Console and environment variables. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common authentication issues like redirect mismatches and token expiration. Document security best practices and compliance considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the reusable UI components in creatorsmeet-2. Categorize components into interactive elements (buttons, forms), layout components (sidebar, navigation), and marketing sections (how-it-works, contact). For each component, document props/attributes, event handlers, and customization options. Include usage examples with code snippets from actual implementation. Explain the styling approach using Tailwind CSS classes and CSS variables. Document accessibility features, keyboard navigation support, and screen reader compatibility. Cover animation implementations using Framer Motion and CSS transitions. Provide guidelines for responsive behavior across device sizes. Address component composition patterns and integration with Next.js App Router. Include performance optimization tips for rendering large lists of components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deploying creatorsmeet-2 to production. Document the Vercel deployment configuration in vercel.json including routes, headers, and rewrites. Explain the build process defined in package.json scripts and next.config.js optimizations. Cover environment variable management across local, preview, and production environments. Detail the PowerShell deployment script (deploy.ps1) for Windows environments. Include database connection considerations for MongoDB Atlas or self-hosted instances. Provide step-by-step deployment instructions for both Vercel and alternative platforms. Address CI/CD pipeline integration, automated testing before deployment, and rollback procedures. Include monitoring and logging recommendations for production systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a step-by-step getting started guide for developers new to creatorsmeet-2. Begin with system requirements and repository cloning instructions. Guide users through environment setup using QUICK_SETUP.md and SETUP_COMPLETE.md, including installing dependencies and configuring environment variables. Provide detailed instructions for setting up Google OAuth as documented in GOOGLE_OAUTH_SETUP.md. Walk through the local development setup with 'npm run dev' and accessing the application at localhost:3000. Include initial project configuration, database connection, and API key setup. Provide troubleshooting tips from CHECKLIST.md for common setup issues. End with a quick tour of the main features and suggested next steps for customization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for common issues in creatorsmeet-2. Organize problems by category: authentication failures, database connectivity issues, AI API errors, and deployment problems. Document diagnostic tools like the database test endpoint (/api/test-db) and Hugging Face test endpoint (/api/test-huggingface). Explain how to interpret error messages and logs from both client and server. Provide step-by-step resolution procedures for each issue type. Include network troubleshooting techniques, environment variable validation, and dependency verification. Cover debugging strategies using the test API interface (app/test-api/page.tsx). Address performance bottlenecks and memory leaks. Reference CHECKLIST.md for pre-deployment validation. Include escalation paths for unresolved issues.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: CreatorsMeet

## 1. Project Introduction

CreatorsMeet is a collaborative platform designed to connect innovators with developers to build groundbreaking projects. The platform leverages AI-powered matching to pair users based on skills, interests, and project requirements, facilitating seamless collaboration between creators and coders.

**Core Goals:**
- Connect innovators with suitable developers based on project requirements
- Provide AI-powered analysis of project ideas to recommend technology stacks
- Facilitate team collaboration with integrated project management tools
- Offer AI mentorship to guide users through their development journey

**Target Audience:**
- Innovators with project ideas but lacking technical implementation skills
- Developers seeking interesting projects to contribute to
- Entrepreneurs looking to build MVPs with technical partners
- Teams requiring AI-assisted project guidance and mentorship

## 2. Technical Architecture

The application follows a modern full-stack architecture built on Next.js with a MongoDB backend, implementing a component-based design pattern with clear separation of concerns.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Data Access]
    D --> E[(MongoDB)]
    C --> F[Hugging Face API]
    G[Auth] --> B
    H[AI Analysis] --> F
```

The architecture consists of:
- **Frontend**: Next.js 14 with React components, using App Router
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom UI components
- **State Management**: React context and server-side rendering
- **Authentication**: NextAuth with JWT tokens
- **Database**: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM
- **AI Integration**: Hugging Face for project analysis and developer matching

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- [layout.tsx](app/layout.tsx)
- [page.tsx](app/page.tsx)
- [middleware.ts](middleware.ts)

### Core Modules
- [User.ts](models/User.ts) - User data model with comprehensive profile and project tracking
- [Project.ts](models/Project.ts) - Project management data model
- [db.ts](lib/db.ts) - Database connection management
- [mongodb.ts](lib/mongodb.ts) - MongoDB client configuration

### Configuration Approach
- [next.config.js](next.config.js) - Next.js configuration
- [tailwind.config.js](tailwind.config.js) - Tailwind CSS configuration
- [package.json](package.json) - Project dependencies and scripts
- [.env.production](.env.production) - Environment variables

### External Dependencies
- [package.json](package.json) - Lists all dependencies including Next.js, React, MongoDB, and Hugging Face integration

### Integration Points
- [signup.ts](app/api/auth/signup.ts) - User registration with AI analysis
- [analyze/route.ts](app/api/project/analyze/route.ts) - Project idea analysis API
- [me/route.ts](app/api/user/me/route.ts) - User profile management
- [assign-mentor/route.ts](app/api/user/assign-mentor/route.ts) - AI mentor assignment

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend] --> B[API Routes]
    B --> C[Database]
    B --> D[AI Services]
    C --> E[MongoDB]
    D --> F[Hugging Face]
    G[Auth] --> B
    H[User Model] --> C
    I[Project Model] --> C
```

## 4. Key Features

### AI-Powered Project Analysis
The platform analyzes project ideas using Hugging Face's zero-shot classification to recommend appropriate technology stacks and identify suitable developers.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> ProjectSubmission
    ProjectSubmission --> AIAnalysis: Submit idea
    AIAnalysis --> TechRecommendation: Analyze with Hugging Face
    TechRecommendation --> DeveloperMatching: Find suitable coders
    DeveloperMatching --> Results: Display matches
    Results --> [*]
```

### User Authentication and Management
Comprehensive authentication system with role-based access control for innovators and developers.

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Signup] --> B[Role Selection]
    B --> C{Innovator?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Project Requirements]
    C -->|No| E[Developer Stack]
    D --> F[AI Analysis]
    E --> G[Profile Creation]
    F --> H[User Saved]
    G --> H
```

### AI Mentor Assignment
The system automatically assigns AI mentors based on user roles and project requirements, providing guidance throughout the development process.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> UserRegistration
    UserRegistration --> RoleSelection: Choose innovator or coder
    RoleSelection --> MentorAssignment: Match with AI mentor
    MentorAssignment --> ProfileSetup: Complete profile
    ProfileSetup --> Dashboard: Access platform
    Dashboard --> [*]
```

### Real-time Collaboration Tools
Integrated project management features including task tracking, milestone management, and performance analytics.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Project Creation] --> B[Task Management]
    B --> C[Milestone Tracking]
    C --> D[Progress Monitoring]
    D --> E[Performance Analytics]
    E --> F[Team Collaboration]
```
</blog>
